metadata.title: CVE-2024-47175 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not sanitize IPP attributes when creating thePPD buffer

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-47175` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-bsd - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-client - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-common - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-core-drivers - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-daemon - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-ipp-utils - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-ppdc - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
cups-server-common - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
libcups2 - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
libcupsimage2 - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.11').
